Dementia Friendly Indianapolis

A community action team dedicated to supporting those living with dementia and their care partners.

Check out our page for connections to resources and events that are inclusive for all community members!

Our Mission

Community Events

Awareness

Education

Resources

Dementia Friendly Indianapolis, established in January 2023, is part of a community network cultivated by Dementia Friendly America. To view the other Dementia Friendly Communities in Indiana, check out https://www.dfindiana.org/.

Event Title

Info

Sep 10th | 5-6 PM

We have over 50 action team members who govern this cross-sector initiative. Action team members meet monthly through a hybrid format-on teams or coming in-person to CICOA Aging & In-Home Solutions' office. As a multi-organizational team, also comprised with people living with dementia and their care partners, we come together to create and promote dementia friendly activities. Check out some of these activities below!

Action Team Organizations

Community Events

Memory Cafes

Our action team hosts memory cafes, as well as promoting and helping other organizations hosting cafes in the area. To check out the upcoming Memory Cafes, click here.

What

A safe and social gathering for people living with dementia and their care partner/loved one.

Where

Anywhere!

Who

For people living with dementia and their loved ones

  • Accessibility is key so all are welcome!

  • Activities can be adapted to all members - even those in the late stages.

Why

Social interaction, FUN!, Community

Fall Festival

Our Fall Festival is a yearly event hosted in support of the ReImagining Dementia-Taking it to the Streets Campaign! Hosted in partnership with University of Indianapolis Center of Aging & Community, this festival is for all community members to come, access resources, and enjoy fall festivities and food!

Our vendor spots are available to Dementia Friendly Indianapolis action team members first, so join us for first dibs!

If you are interested in sponsoring part of our Fall Festival, please fill out the sponsorship form and send it to hhess@cicoa.org.

Living Well with Dementia

Living Well with Dementia events highlights community members in the area who are truly living well with a dementia diagnosis, and gives them an opportunity to share their story with others. CICOA Aging & In-Home Solutions and the Alzheimer's Association share what resources they offer to help those in the community.

We have hosted this event several times with organizations such as the following: Shelby Senior Center, Independent Adult Day Center, Still Waters Adult Day Center, and A Senior Retreat.

You can request to host a Living Well with Dementia event here:

Contact us

Have any questions? Feel free to contact us here!

Holly Hess

DFI Liaison

Contact: hhess@cicoa.org

Holly Hess graduated from Indiana University Bloomington with master's and bachelor's degrees in healthcare management. During her time in college, she worked as a CNA in multiple healthcare settings including home health and long-term care.  After working as a CNA, she is thrilled to have the opportunity to advocate and serve those living with dementia and their care partners. Holly has been on CICOA's staff for two years, and just recently received my Certified Dementia Practitioner (CDP) license! She also serves as the regional liaison for any up and coming communities in Central Indiana.
